benchmark_details.name: Sentient Agent as a Judge (SAGE)
benchmark_details.overview: SAGE is an automated evaluation framework designed to measure higher-order social cognition in large language models (LLMs) by simulating human-like emotional changes and inner thought processes during interactions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an interpretable and rigorous tool for evaluating and tracking progress in the social and emotional capabilities of language models.

data.source: Constructed dialogue scenarios and existing supportive dialogue contexts.

methodology.calculation: The Sentient emotion score is calculated based on the simulated emotional trajectory and the agent's inner reasoning during dialogue.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Sentient scores indicate better performance in empathetic engagement and social cognition.
methodology.baseline_results: Top models showed significant performance gaps in social cognition metrics, demonstrating the effectiveness of SAGE in evaluation.
methodology.validation: The correlation between Sentient emotion scores and BLRI ratings validates the psychological fidelity of the evaluation framework.
